com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor

Class FileSystemAdaptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.Adaptor
      • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.FileSystemAdaptor

  • public class FileSystemAdaptor
extends Adaptor
    An adaptor for reading from and writing to safe, designated directories on the YADA server.
    Since:
    0.4.0.0
    Author:
    David Varon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private String data
      The content to be written to the file when the query type is QueryUtils.WRITE or QueryUtils.APPEND
      private static org.apache.log4j.Logger l
      Local logger handle
      protected static String NON_READ_SFX_RX
      Constant equal to: "<{1,2}.*"
      protected static String PARAM_SYMBOL_RX
      Constant equal to: "([\\/=:<])(\\?[idvn])"
      protected static Pattern PARAM_URL_RX
      Constant equal to: ".+"+PARAM_SYMBOL_RX+".*"
      private static String PROTOCOL
      Constant equal to: "file://"
      protected static Pattern SOURCE_RX
      Constant equal to: "^file:\\/\\/\\/(io\\/(in|out))(\\/.+)*$"

      The request query string

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(YADAQuery yq)
             throws YADAAdaptorExecutionException
        Currently supports directory READ, only that return single-level depth and WRITE and APPEND operations for single files. WRITEs can be performed on non-existent files, and currently there is no security attached to ensure non-executables only can be written.
        Overrides:
        execute in class Adaptor
        Parameters:
        yq - the YADAQuery containing the code to execute
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorExecutionException - when the execution fails as a result of an IO error or Resource error, e.g., a problem accessing or reading a file

      • build

        public String build(YADAQuery yq)
             throws YADAAdaptorException
        Returns the full path to be processed by the adaptor
        Overrides:
        build in class Adaptor
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the code to build
        Returns:
        the path to the desired file system location
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - if there was an issue with accessing the JNDI source stored in yq

      • setUri

        public void setUri(String uri)
        Standard mutator for variable.
        Parameters:
        uri - the url path and parameter portion of the request string

      • getUri

        public String getUri()
        Standard accessor for variable.
        Returns:
        the url portion of the query

      • setData

        public void setData(String data)
        Standard mutator for variable. data is passed as a url parameter in the query string and ultimately written or appended to a file.
        Parameters:
        data - the content to write or append

      • getData

        public String getData()
        Standard accessor for variable.
        Returns:
        the data to be written to the filesystem
